title: Estimating sample size for a change-from-baseline analysis
text: standard frequentist approach change--baseline analysis one-sample t-test sample paired differences. precision estimate therefore dependent standard deviation paired differences. \[ \bar{X} \pm \frac{t_{1-\alpha/2, n-1} \sigma}{\sqrt{n}} \]\(n\) sample size, \(\alpha\) type 1 error rate, \(\sigma\) estimated sample standard deviation. equation two-sided test. Estimating precision sample size (given precision) scenario simple already standard deviation paired differences. can sourced descriptive statistics table change--baseline endpoint previous clinical trial report observational study. , leveraged presize R package. qtils package also provides convenient function turn presize objects nice flextable objects. Hypothetical Mean Std. Dev Precision Sample size Confidence Level Interval 0 3 0.5952651 100 0.95 -0.6 , 0.6
code: presize::prec_mean(mean = 0, sd = 3, n = 100, conf.width = NULL, conf.level = 0.95) |>      as_flextable(show = 'half-width')

what: Unknown standard deviation of the differences
title: Estimating sample size for a change-from-baseline analysis
text: However, direct source standard deviation paired differences, can compute based standard deviation either pre-treament value, post-treament value, , making certain assumptions correlation. qtils package provides convenient approach based following relationship: \[ \sigma^2_{\bar{d}} = \sigma^2_{prior} + \sigma^2_{post} - 2 \sigma_{prior} \sigma_{post}\rho \] \(\rho\) correlation two measurements. Usually set correlation around 0.6 (Meyer, Richter, Raspe 2013). Hypothetical Mean Std. Dev Precision Sample size Confidence Level Interval 50 15.49193 7.250448 20 0.95 42.75 , 57.25 50 15.49193 5.784783 30 0.95 44.22 , 55.78 50 15.49193 4.954561 40 0.95 45.05 , 54.95
code: qtils::prec_paireddiff(n = c(20,30,40), sd1 = 20, cor = 0.7, mean = 50) |>      as_flextable(show = 'half-width')

title: Estimating sample size for a change-from-baseline analysis
text: also instances variable interest log-normally distributed, usually cases outcome continuous strictly positive (non-zero) outcome. , estimand original scale change--baseline technically geometric mean fold-change--baseline, can converted percentage change. back-transformation results log space (fold-change percentage-change) non-symmetrical. However, need specify standard deviation either paired differences paired measurements (baseline post-baseline). can utilize relationship coefficient variation (CV - original scale) standard deviation log. \[ CV_{X} = \sqrt{e^{\sigma_{log}^2} - 1} \] \(\sigma_{log}^2\) variance variable log-form. , transformation function inverse implemented qtils via cv2log function log-transformation performed, back-transformation can done conveniently specifying log_trans option prec_paireddiff function get values original scale. However, means report confidence interval half-width since longer symmetrical. Log Mean Log Std. Dev Sample size Conf. Width Confidence Level Mean (Orig. Scale) Coeff. Variation Interval 3 0.5648193 20 10.743070 0.95 20.08554 0.613009 15.42 , 26.16 3 0.5648193 30 8.535312 0.95 20.08554 0.613009 16.27 , 24.8 3 0.5648193 40 7.295949 0.95 20.08554 0.613009 16.77 , 24.06
code: qtils::cv2sdlog(x = 0.7) #> [1] 0.6314872 qtils::cv2sdlog(x = 2, inverse=TRUE) #> [1] 7.321076 sd1 <- qtils::cv2sdlog(x = 0.7)  qtils::prec_paireddiff(n = c(20,30,40), prec = NULL, sd1 = sd1, cor = 0.6, mean = 3,                         conf_level = 0.95) |>      qtils::presize_log_backtransform() |>      as_flextable(show = "full-width") #> Warning in qtils::presize_log_backtransform(qtils::prec_paireddiff(n = c(20, : #> Please do not report half-widhts if log-transformation was performed

title: Plot observed trajectories of longitudinal data — qplot_obs_long
text: mean trajectories, table representing number non-NA observations reported along-side table. confidence interval computed based normal approximation: \(m + 1.96 * SE\). function label axes specify color scheme themeing. words, themes labels added analyst .

title: Plot observed trajectories of longitudinal data — qplot_obs_long
code: data(rand_adlb) df <- rand_adlb |> dplyr::filter(PARAMCD == "ALT") |>      dplyr::mutate(AVISIT = factor(AVISIT)) qplot_obs_long(df = df, ptype = "mean", var = AVAL,      tvar = AVISIT, id = USUBJID, col_by = TRT01A)

what: Obtain the rates of toxicity events by grade. — toxicity_by_grade
title: Obtain the rates of toxicity events by grade. — toxicity_by_grade
text: Function obtain toxicity rates grade (grade 0-1, grade 2, grade 3 ). uses model assumed Simon et al. demonstrating utility accelerated titration design. method implements assumptions made Mi et al. 2021. function factory.

title: Obtain the rates of toxicity events by grade. — toxicity_by_grade
Obtain the rates of toxicity events by grade. — toxicity_by_grade
text: dlt_rates Vector. DLT rate first two doses order. ... used.

title: Obtain the rates of toxicity events by grade. — toxicity_by_grade
text: list functions (vectorized) taking account argument dose integer specifying dose level (e.g. 1,2, 3, 4, 5). return vector probabilities per dose grade1: Generating probabilities grade 0 - 1 grade2: Generating probabilities grade 2 events higher (DLT) dlt: Generating probabilities DLT

title: Obtain the rates of toxicity events by grade. — toxicity_by_grade
text: Details can found supplemental section following manuscript  Mi et al. 2021, SPA: Single patient acceleration oncology dose-escalation trials, Contemporary Clinical Trials. ISSN 1551-7144, https://doi.org/10.1016/j.cct.2021.106378.

title: qtils 0.1.0
text: Added support precision-based sample size estimation change--baseline analyses, including vignette. Release version.

title: qtils 0.0.9003
text: Added support facets observed longitudinal trajectories
